header.title: Perspectives on Esotericism and Self-Evolution: A Collection of Articles from The Infinity Network

central_thesis: This collection advocates for individual self-expression and personal evolution through the exploration of diverse perspectives on reality, consciousness, and magical practices. It emphasizes introspection, the expansion of understanding, and the pursuit of ultimate realization of infinite potential by engaging with various esoteric and spiritual frameworks.

structure_content.summary: The Infinity Network promotes self-expression and the sharing of personal perspectives as a means for individual and collective evolution. It posits that introspection through writing reveals unrealized perspectives, contributing to an aspect of evolution, and encourages mutual sharing to widen understanding and aid in personal awakening, ultimately seeking the realization of infinite potential.

Orme explores 'the void' as the primordial source of all energy, probability, and creativity, which is beyond human language and only graspable through feeling and a higher understanding of reality. Reality is presented as subjective, shaped by individual perceptions and will. The void is paradoxically 'full of nothing, full of everything'. The author encourages questioning and warns that increased knowledge may lead to a deeper awareness of how little is truly known, fostering a path toward becoming a 'creator god' of one's own reality.

Jaiden Null outlines a hierarchical cosmology: starting from the 'Human realm' (lowest, magick-resistant), ascending to the 'Astral' (spirit travel, magick conduit), then the 'Aetheric' (thoughts, ideas, Collective Subconscious). Above these is the 'Chaos Realm', the ultimate random creative force of the multiverse, which occultists tap into. At the core of Chaos is 'Null', its mother, existing prior to Chaos and containing the 'never thought of and never imagined', capable of inducing insanity. Null is depicted as eventually consuming Chaos, returning the multiverse to 'Nothing'.

Simica examines the subtle energy exchanges in human interactions. Individuals unconsciously absorb energy, discerning emotional states from others. Body language, while expressive, can be misleading. The article discusses 'energy leaches' - individuals who drain others' energy, often unknowingly, causing feelings of exhaustion. It provides guidance on recognizing and breaking these detrimental energy connections, suggesting that even a thought of the other person can re-establish a link.

Sarah-la posits 'love energy' as an intrinsic, personal energy subject to the law of conservation. Falling in love occurs when compatible love energies combine. Love fades when these energies shift or become incompatible. The loss of love is felt as an emptiness, a loss of half one's energy supply, necessitating a period of readjustment. True, lasting love is described as a rare phenomenon where energies are so perfectly matched that they sync, grow, and adapt together over time.

structure_content.chapter_title: Fractal Model of Self-Consciousness: A Proposal of Concept of Machine Consciousness
structure_content.summary: John Thomas Didymus explores the 'nonbeing-ness' of physical things from the 'Axiom of Transcendence'. He proposes that biological self-consciousness possesses a fractal structure, where the degree of consciousness relates to its 'scale invariant' recursive properties. The article argues that any self-organizing system obeying the rule 'part is less than the whole' is a machine, implying a limited self-consciousness constrained by 'nanotechnical' factors, leading to 'Planck scale' singularities. Machine systems bypass ontological problems by arbitrarily adopting a 'Planck unit' as their origin.

Maire Hell offers a personal insight into Germanic Heathenry, distinguishing it from modern 'Neo-Heathenism' and connecting it to ancient traditions where deities co-evolved with people. The cosmos is understood as ruled by chaos, yet order is necessary for prosperity. The author emphasizes action over worship for personal meaning and growth. The Heathen goal is 'transformation' into a god-like state, exemplified by Wuotan/Odin's pursuit of wisdom through Runes, which encode cosmic laws. The text stresses self-reliance and influencing 'Wyrd' (fate) rather than undoing it, accepting personal limits as a path to freedom.

structure_content.chapter_title: Sigil Magic - What it is and How to Get Started
structure_content.summary: Karl Trigona introduces Sigil Magic, a technique from Austin Osman Spare, as a method to achieve specific ends through focused intention. The practical steps involve writing a desired statement in the present tense, then creating a sigil by abstracting and combining the letters, making it unrecognizable. After discarding the original statement, the sigil is 'charged' by intense focus during an altered state of consciousness (e.g., meditation, dancing, masturbation). The crucial final step is to 'forget' the sigil for a period, allowing the subconscious to work, before eventually re-meditating on it for full integration and manifestation.

This article outlines the basic principles of the 7 main chakras, described as torus-shaped energy centers correlating with endocrine glands. Each chakra (Crown, Brow, Throat, Heart, Solar Plexus, Sacral, Root) is detailed by its Sanskrit name, location, associated qualities/functions, specific crystals, corresponding body areas, and suggested exercises (meditation, physical activity, visualizations) for activation and balance. The 'aura' or 'aether' is also discussed as an 'eighth chakra', mediating cosmic consciousness.

Laura describes 'The All' as the Hermetic/panentheistic concept of God, encompassing everything that exists and can be experienced, possessing both masculine and feminine qualities. The author views herself as a seeker, connecting to 'The All' through nature (Father Sky, Mother Earth, rivers, mountains) and recognizing it as the creator. She emphasizes allowing true desires as a path to connection and performs full moon rites to project intent, seeing magic as energy and intent directed towards 'The All'. The ultimate message is to simplify life, embrace love and laughter, and connect with the joy and pain of 'The All'.

structure_content.chapter_title: Belief Systems; Are They ALL Wrong?
structure_content.summary: Peggy Androes argues for the individuality of belief systems, asserting that no single approach is universally 'correct'. She contrasts viewing deities as literal beings versus conceptual ideas, using Ares as an example of channeled presence. The author highlights the diversity in magical practices, such as different methods for casting a circle and elemental associations, emphasizing that 'nothing is impossible' in the craft. She critiques judgment within the pagan community, advocating for acceptance and respect for all belief systems to foster collective evolution.

Anthony J Pace proposes a 'Cosmic Religion' that transcends definition, dogma, and tradition, advocating for an organic, evolving, and pragmatic spirituality. This framework would integrate truths from both traditional religions and science, focusing on subjective experience and personal revelation. It conceptualizes various belief systems as 'supply kits and maps' for a spiritual 'quest' towards self-realization or 'Divinity'. The author emphasizes the impact of technological advancement on human action and spirituality, advocating for 'cosmic routine' aligned with the universal flow ('Tao') and the mathematical elegance of the natural world.

Tamara Star recounts her journey to identifying as a 'Warlock', defining it as a path of serving and protecting 'Truth', distinct from traditional Wicca and historical misconceptions. She traces the Warlock lineage to Queen Poppa de Bayeux (932 CE), emphasizing independence from worldly authority and a commitment to investigation and knowledge. Warlocks, in this tradition, engage in 'scientific based Free Energy Manipulation involving the use of silver' rather than spirit invocation. Her personal evolution involved integrating 'spiritual' and 'scientific' concepts, recognizing her role within a 'Singular Collective', and pursuing continuous self-analysis and spiritual seeking.

structure_content.chapter_title: Chaos Magic - Secret Source Of All Power
structure_content.summary: Enoch Tan defines Chaos Magic as a practice without inherent rules, governed by the principle 'the rule is that there are no rules'. It operates through 'metabelief', where belief itself is a manipulable tool for achieving effects, rather than an end. Gnosis, a state of single-minded focus without rational thought, is the key to imprinting intentions onto the subconscious. The article clarifies 'chaos' as the original Greek 'vast gulf' or 'abyss', representing unperceived unity and pure potentiality, akin to the Eastern Tao, not merely disorder. Practitioners are encouraged to adopt and discard belief systems fluidly and focus on the underlying natural laws of magic.

Frater Seth A. Moris introduces Egomagic as a magical technique focused on manipulating the Ego, both one's own and others'. The Ego, a defense mechanism, is prone to 'cracks in the armor' due to flaws in internal logic. Offensive Egomagic involves actively assaulting another's Ego through focused will and power, by exposing these logical fallacies. This can be done harshly ('Power minus a Defense = Impact') or subtly ('Subtlety greater than Awareness + Power minus Defenses = Impact') to gently reshape beliefs, requiring continuous impact for unconscious acceptance and reformatting of the subject's belief system.

Athenas Echo describes the 'Sage Twist' (bharadvajasana), a yoga pose designed to release tension in the shoulders, neck, and spine, improve digestion, massage abdominal organs, and relieve backaches and stress. Detailed instructions are provided for sitting, positioning arms and legs, twisting on exhale, and elongating the spine on inhale, holding for several breaths. Safety guidelines advise against over-twisting, and contraindications include headaches, blood pressure issues, menstruation, and insomnia.

Kye Rendosa explores 'Rage' as a potent emotional-based 'majik', treating it as a raw, primal energy akin to elemental forces that can amplify will. The technique involves first observing the subconscious physical changes during reactive rage (e.g., quickened pulse, tense jaw). Then, these physical responses are mimicked to invoke the state intentionally. This is combined with a visualization of rage as a 'red mist' that forms a 'hurricane' with a calm 'eye', where the practitioner stands to draw energy without being consumed. The core principle is understanding and manipulating emotional patterns through disciplined practice.

Jarrod Ean-Dixon passionately defends individualism, arguing that self-interest ultimately benefits society. He criticizes conformity and collectivist ideologies, which he sees as stifling innovation and reducing individuals to 'carbon copies'. The author champions personal responsibility, making one's own mistakes, and earning individual rewards, encouraging readers to reject external pressures and embrace a unique, self-directed path.

Suzanne Dome's short, poetic piece reflects on silence, a 'vacuum' where communication fails. The narrator describes being enshrouded in 'blackness', unable to transmit thoughts effectively, leading to distorted creations that neither remember nor listen. The piece conveys a sense of isolation and the futility of communication when it cannot be heard or absorbed, hinting at a profound disconnect.

key_concepts.definition: The primordial source of all energy, probability, and creativity; infinite and bottomless, beyond human words, perceivable through feeling in the mind's eye. Paradoxically 'full of nothing, full of everything'.
Nonexistent outside individual perceptions, it can be shaped, bent, and embodied through internal power and sheer will.
The ultimate force that created the universe; it thinks without intellect, operates randomly, and is the source from which occultists manifest magick. Contains Null at its core.

The mother of Chaos, existing before Chaos. It is the core of the Chaos Realm, containing everything 'never thought of and never imagined', and is said to induce insanity if entered. It will eventually consume Chaos.
A database of all thoughts and knowledge from every living and non-living being in the universe, residing in the Aetheric plane, along with hidden occult secrets.
The unconscious absorption and exchange of emotional energy between individuals, which can lead to feelings of being 'drained' by 'leaches' or uplifted by compatible connections.

A personal energy produced by being alive, subject to the law of conservation. Compatibility of this energy explains attraction, while shifts in compatibility lead to its fading or loss. Sustained 'true love' involves mutual syncing and growth of these energies.

A self-organizing system. In the context of consciousness, if it adheres to the 'part is less than the whole' rule, it can be considered a machine system, regardless of its organic or inorganic substance.
A concept analogous to fate or Dao, which governs all existence. It can be influenced to one's advantage but cannot be undone or replaced, akin to shaping a stream but not making the water disappear.

A Chaos Magic technique by Austin Osman Spare for manifesting desires. It involves abstracting a written statement into a symbolic glyph (sigil), charging it in an altered state of consciousness, and then 'forgetting' it to allow the subconscious to work, followed by later re-meditation for full integration.

One of seven primary energy centers in the body, associated with specific colors, locations, endocrine glands, qualities (e.g., identity, emotion), and corresponding body areas. They are depicted as torus-shaped gatherings of energy.

The Hermetic and panentheistic view of God; everything that exists or can be experienced, comprising all masculine and feminine qualities. It is the Universe, the creator of all, and the source to which magic and intent are projected.

A core principle of Chaos Magic where belief itself is viewed as a tool for achieving effects, rather than an absolute truth or end in itself. Belief is a psychological state that can be deliberately manipulated by will.

A special state of consciousness used in Chaos Magic, characterized by single-minded focus on a single point, thought, or goal, with all other thoughts excluded. It is considered a gateway to the subconscious for implanting intentions.

Magical action specifically designed to manipulate the Ego, either one's own or another's. It involves exploiting 'cracks in the armor' (flaws in internal logic) of the Ego through focused will and psychological techniques to reshape beliefs or elicit emotional responses.

A form of emotional-based magic that harnesses the raw, primal energy of rage. It involves consciously mimicking the physical responses to rage and using visualization (a 'red mist' or 'hurricane' with a calm 'eye') to draw and control this intense energy for amplification of will and intent.

One who serves and protects 'Truth', tracing lineage to Queen Poppa de Bayeux (932 CE). They investigate all topics, protect individual rights, and practice 'scientific based Free Energy Manipulation involving the use of silver' rather than invoking spirits, rejecting traditional hierarchies and dogmas.

practical_system.description: The collection presents several practical systems for personal and magical development, rooted in the manipulation of internal states, belief, and subtle energies. These range from structured magical techniques to philosophical frameworks that guide operative work. A core tenet is the individual's capacity to shape reality through focused will and intentional practice. Emphasis is placed on introspection, understanding underlying principles, and the fluidity of belief systems as tools for manifestation.
tools: White paper and permanent marker: Essential for creating Sigils.
Crystals and stones: Specific types are prescribed for balancing and enhancing each Chakra's energy (e.g., amethyst for Crown, sodalite for Third Eye, citrine for Solar Plexus, red jasper for Root).
Altered states of consciousness: Induced through various means (e.g., music, dance, meditation, masturbation) for sigil charging and attaining Gnosis in Chaos Magic.
Will, intention, and focus: Primary mental tools for directing magical energy and shaping reality in all systems.
Introspection and self-awareness: Crucial for identifying 'cracks in the armor' for Egomagic, understanding one's 'love energy', and perceiving the underlying principles of various magical systems.
Physical body: Used for mimicry in Rage Majik and various exercises for Chakra activation.
Visualization: Utilized in Sigil Magic, Chakra work, and Rage Majik to manifest and control energy.
Silver: Mentioned in 'I Am Warlock' as a tool for 'scientific based Free Energy Manipulation'.
rituals: Sigil creation: Abstracting intentions into symbolic glyphs for subconscious programming.
Sigil charging: Imbuing sigils with energy through altered states of consciousness (e.g., music, dance, meditation, masturbation) to bypass conscious censorship.
Sigil forgetting: Deliberately forgetting the sigil's intent to allow subconscious work without conscious interference, followed by re-meditation for integration.

Egomagic: Strategic psychological manipulation of one's own or another's Ego through focused intent, either through forceful 'assault' (Power minus a Defense = Impact) or subtle, continuous 'molding' (Subtlety greater than Awareness + Power minus Defenses = Impact).

Chakra activation: Engaging specific energy centers through meditation, prayer, verbal communication, singing, chanting, visualizations (e.g., remote viewing, lucid dreaming), and targeted physical exercises (e.g., pushups, belly dance, squats, pelvic thrusts).
Full moon rites: Rituals performed during the full moon to connect with 'The All', project intent, and cast goals.

Rage majik: Invoking and harnessing rage by mimicking its physical manifestations and employing visualization (e.g., 'red mist' becoming a 'hurricane' with a calm 'eye') to amplify will and direct destructive or transformative energy.
Germanic Heathen practices: Traditional rites and taboos, understood not as rigid worship but as actions to find personal meaning and influence 'Wyrd' (fate), with a focus on self-reliance.

relevant_quotes.text: The Infinity Network encourages self expression. In sharing our personal perspectives we not only learn from each other but also about ourselves. The writing of an article can be a seriously introspective process as you have to not only break down and organize your ideas, but also find the best expression for them. In this you may learn you have perspectives you didn't even realize until you put them onto paper. This is an aspect of evolution. Widen your perspective, share with others that they may either widen their own or see where they have been in the past. Infinity Network is a community, we desire through interaction and the sharing or perspective to help each other evolve and wake up. Remember in reading these articles they are personal perspectives. We are all on different personal paths of evolution and all in different stages or platforms of realization.

The void is the thing that which is the source of all energy, probability, and creativity; a thing that can be made simple. The void is all things within infinite in width bottomless in depth words do not transcribe properly what it is, there are not human words for that which can only be seen in the mind's eye, that can only be felt. Through knowledge and attaining a higher understanding of reality can we only hope to glimpse it, but yet we are it we control it.

From the dawn of time man has set about to explain, categorize and name levels of consciousness, creation, and existence. Here is one thought provoking and highly sensical viewpoint. Perhaps it can widen your perspective?

The total amount of energy in an isolated system remains constant over time. A consequence of this law is that energy can neither be created nor destroyed, it can only be transformed from one state to another.
The notion of ontological "emptiness," or more meaningfully, "nonbeing-ness" of physical things follows from the "Axiom of Transcendence."
I as Heathen understand the cosmos and everything it gives birth to as ruled by chaos, naturally. Yet humankind and gods need Order to exist and prosper.

Most gods die during Ragnarok (the judgment of the Gods, meaning, the Gods being judged), which is their fate, and Wuotans core desire is to avoid Ragnarok. Regardless of my own interpretation of when and how exactly Ragnarok takes place, and yes, I did some really crazy interpretations to amuse myself, the underlying theme is that all that is and not is, is brought to existence, governed and penetrated by Wyrd, which would be "fate”. I would go a little farther and call it Dao. It is non personal, collective and personal, it can be influenced, like you influence the stream, but you cannot make the water disappear, just like you can't make any matter truly disappear.
Sigil magic is a technique of the (non-stage) magical arts originally put forth by Austin Osman Spare, often referred to as the father of chaos magic.

The All (also called The One, The Absolute, The Great One, The Creator, The Supreme Mind, The Supreme Good, The Father, and The Universal Mother) is the Hermetic or panentheistic view of God, which is that everything that is, or at least that can be experienced, collectively makes up The All. One Hermetic maxim states, "While All is in The All, it is equally true that The All is in All. The All can also seen to be androgynous, possessing both masculine and feminine qualities in equal part.

Definition is limitation; therefore a cosmic religion would remain undefined. Rather, it would be as organic as humanity itself - ever growing, evolving and simplifying. Dogmatic peonage would be replaced by pragmatism. Despite such promise, practitioners of such methodology would be hesitant to scowl at traditional spiritual approaches - as to do so would be to fall into pits that lead to their irrelevancy.
Warlock: Old Norse varð-lokkur, "caller of spirits"

Chaos magic is magic without limitations. The rule is that there are no rules. You choose what the rules are, you choose everything. "Do what thou wilt shall be the whole of the Law." It is a form of no holds bared magic. "Nothing is true, everything is permitted." Chaos Magic deals with subjective reality rather than objective reality.

"When the ego is personified, it is like a slave to three harsh masters: the id, the super-ego, and the external world. It has to do its best to suit all three, thus is constantly feeling hemmed by the danger of causing discontent on two other sides. It is said, however, that the ego seems to be more loyal to the id, preferring to gloss over the finer details of reality to minimize conflicts while pretending to have a regard for reality. But the super-ego is constantly watching every one of the ego's moves and punishes it with feelings of guilt, anxiety, and inferiority. To overcome this the ego employs defense mechanisms. The defense mechanisms are not done so directly or consciously. They lessen the tension by covering up our impulses that are threatening." -Wikipedia. on The Ego.

"Yoga, an ancient but perfect science, deals with the evolution of humanity. This evolution includes all aspects of one's being, from bodily health to self-realization. Yoga means union - the union of body with consciousness and consciousness with the soul. Yoga cultivates the ways of maintaining a balanced attitude in day-to-day life and endows skill in the performance of one's actions." -B.K.S. Iyengar, Astadala Yogamala

Emotional based majik is a fickle thing. Though there can be much power behind it, it often has a fast crescendo and leaves little time for clear focus of intent. To me, working with emotional majik is much like working with elemental majik. Both are natural, and you can use this organic energy to amplify your will. The trick to emotional majik is not only in harnessing the raw power of emotional response, but also in being able to call forth this force at will. My favorite emotion to use in majik is rage.

Individualism - There are many ways to apply this concept. Dr. Seuss once said, “Be who you are and say what you feel, because those who mind don't matter and those who matter don't mind.” James Frank Dobie proclaimed, "Conform and be dull”. And Notorious BIG and Method Man rapped, “Fuck the world, don't ask me for shit. Everything you get you gotta work hard for it”. No matter how you look at things the truth of the matter is that individuals working in their own self interests, promote society as a whole, (somebody said that).

critical_analysis.relevance: This collection is highly relevant to contemporary esotericism and occultism, reflecting a syncretic and experimental approach prevalent in modern magical practices, particularly Chaos Magic. It effectively contextualizes various practices (Sigil Magic, Chakra work, Heathenry, Egomagic) within a broader framework of self-exploration and personal evolution. The emphasis on subjective reality, psychological manipulation, and the individual's role in creating their reality aligns with the cutting edge of operative magical theory and practice. The inclusion of diverse perspectives fosters a nuanced understanding of magic's philosophical underpinnings and practical applications beyond rigid dogmas.
critical_analysis.target_audience: The target audience for this collection includes aspiring and experienced practitioners of modern magic (especially Chaos Magicians), spiritual seekers interested in self-development through esoteric philosophy, individuals exploring diverse belief systems, and those interested in the subjective and psychological dimensions of reality and consciousness. Its accessible yet technical language makes it suitable for both a curious layperson and a seasoned occultist looking for fresh perspectives or comparative analyses.
